valueString:
EXAM:MRI BRACHIAL PLEXUS W/WO CONTRASTI


INDICATION: extensive schwannoma of the brachial plexus with progressive left arm proximal and distal weakness, plan for surgery


COMPARISON: MRI brachial plexus 3/8/2022


TECHNIQUE:  High resolution MRI of the cervical spine and brachial plexus, employing MR neurography techniques on a 3 Tesla system using multiplanar 3-D anatomical and fluid sensitive sequences without IV contrast.


FINDINGS:


CERVICAL SPINE:
Intracranial and maxillofacial contents:  Intact.
Head and neck soft tissues:  Intact.
Prevertebral and paraspinous muscles: Intact.
Lung apices:  Intact.


Craniocervical junction:  Intact.
Spinal cord:  Intact.


Bones:  The vertebral heights are preserved.  The marrow signal is unremarkable.
Alignment:  Anatomical.


Atlanto-occipital:  Intact.
Atlanto-dental:  Intact.


Subaxial C-spine:
C2-C3:  Patent right neural foramen. Spinal canal measures 1.6 cm in AP dimension. Focal 1.9 x 0.8 cm left foraminal mass with minimal intraspinal extension to involve the dorsal preganglionic nerve root on the left, slightly increased from prior.
C3-C4:  Patent right neural foramen. Spinal canal measures 1.5 cm in AP dimension. Focal 2.1 x 1.2 cm left foraminal mass with minimal intraspinal extension and posterior paraspinal extension, similar to prior.
C4-C5:  Right foraminal mass measuring 1.0 x 0.8 cm. Left foraminal mass measuring 2.1 x 1.0 cm with increased intraspinal extension to involve the preganglionic nerve root on the left, increased from prior. Small posterior disc bulge.
C5-C6:  Bilateral left greater than right foraminal masses, measuring 1.8 x 1.3 cm on the left and 0.4 x 0.5 cm on the right. Shallow posterior disc bulge with central protrusion.
C6-C7:  Bilateral left greater than right foraminal masses. Small disc bulge with central protrusion.
C7-T1:  Bilateral left greater than right foraminal masses. No spinal canal narrowing.


BRACHIAL PLEXUS:
Nerves:
Brachial plexus:  Multiple bilateral peripheral nerve sheath tumors:
Left neuroforaminal plexiform lesion at the level of C4-C5 with extraspinal extension measuring 4.5 x 3.1 cm (craniocaudal by anterior-posterior), previously 4.3 x 2.7 cm, increased in size. Range of ADC values from 1.7-3.0, average 2.0.
Prevertebral lesion at the left lateral larynx measuring 2.9 x 1.5 cm, similar to prior. ADC measurement limited by artifact.
Multiple other T2 hyperintense and heterogeneously enhancing masses throughout the neck appear unchanged in size.
Heterogeneous mass at the level of the right apex with minimal posterior enhancement measures 4.7 x 2.7 cm, previously 4.4 x 2.6 cm, overall similar in size. ADC measurement limited by artifact.
Heterogeneous mass at the left posterior medial apex measures 3.3 x 1.9 cm, similar in size to prior.


Muscles / Tendons:
Scalenes:  Intact.
Other muscles:  Mild asymmetric atrophy of the left supraspinatus, infraspinatus, and subscapularis and deltoid muscle compared to the right. Moderate paraspinal muscular atrophy with fatty replacement.


Joints:
Sternoclavicular joints:  Normal.
Acromioclavicular joints:  Mild osteoarthrosis bilaterally.
Glenohumeral joints:  Normal.


Bones:  Otherwise intact.
Vessels:  Intact.
